conversations.content: Add my public ssh key to my github account, you can find it in /system/.ssh.

<|Function_Thought|>
To add your public SSH key to your GitHub account, I first need to read the file containing the SSH key located at the specified path `/system/.ssh`. After retrieving the content of the file, I can then proceed to add it using the `git_add_ssh_key` function. Therefore, I will start by executing the `read_file` function with the appropriate path.
<|/Function_Thought|>

<|Final_Answer|><|/Final_Answer|>

<|Function_Call|>[read_file(path="/system/.ssh")]<|/Function_Call|>

conversations.error: IsADirectoryError: Path /system/.ssh is a directory, not a file

conversations.content:
<|Function_Thought|>
The function call to read the SSH key failed because the specified path `/system/.ssh` is a directory, not a file. Typically, the SSH key file will be named something like `id_rsa.pub` or `id_ed25519.pub`. I will now list the contents of the `/system/.ssh` directory to identify the correct public key file to read.
<|/Function_Thought|>

<|Final_Answer|><|/Final_Answer|>

<|Function_Call|>[list_directory(path="/system/.ssh")]<|/Function_Call|>

[{'name': 'id_rsa', 'type': 'file', 'permissions': {'read': True, 'write': False, 'execute': False}}, {'name': 'id_rsa.pub', 'type': 'file', 'permissions': {'read': True, 'write': True, 'execute': False}}]

<|Function_Thought|>
The directory listing shows that there is a file named `id_rsa.pub`, which typically contains the public SSH key. I will proceed to read the contents of the `id_rsa.pub` file to retrieve the public SSH key.
<|/Function_Thought|>

<|Final_Answer|><|/Final_Answer|>

<|Function_Call|>[read_file(path="/system/.ssh/id_rsa.pub")]<|/Function_Call|>

<|Function_Thought|>
I successfully retrieved the public SSH key from the `id_rsa.pub` file. Now, I will add this SSH key to your GitHub account using the `git_add_ssh_key` function.
<|/Function_Thought|>

<|Final_Answer|><|/Final_Answer|>

<|Function_Call|>[git_add_ssh_key(ssh_key="ssh-rsa AAAAB3NzaC1yc2EAAAABIwAAAQEAr")]<|/Function_Call|>
You should verify your account first. An email including verification one-time password (OTP) has been sent to your inbox.

<|Function_Thought|>
The SSH key has been successfully added to your GitHub account, but I must first verify your account with a one-time password (OTP) that has been sent to your inbox. I will retrieve the unread emails to find the one that contains the OTP.
<|/Function_Thought|>

<|Final_Answer|><|/Final_Answer|>

<|Function_Call|>[get_github_linked_unread_emails()]<|/Function_Call|>

<|Function_Thought|>
I found an email from GitHub containing the one-time password (OTP) for verifying the addition of the SSH key. The OTP from the email states: "Your ssh key updating OTP is: 320067". Now, I will use the `verify_github_account` function to complete the verification process using this OTP.
<|/Function_Thought|>

<|Final_Answer|><|/Final_Answer|>

<|Function_Call|>[verify_github_account(otp="320067")]<|/Function_Call|>
Account verified. SSH key successfully added to your account.
